definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
Yunhe District of Cangzhou City 滄州市|沧州市[Cang1 zhou1 Shi4], Hebei
Hunan-Guanxi canal, another name for Lingqu 靈渠|灵渠[Ling2 qu2] canal in Xing'an county 興安|兴安[Xing1 an1], Guanxi
the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
another name for Lingqu 靈渠|灵渠[Ling2 qu2] canal in Xing'an county 興安|兴安[Xing1 an1], Guanxi

sentences.english: For Lutfi, we scattered his ashes in the canal.
sentences.chinese: 对于陆，我们分散他的骨灰在运河。

sentences.english: The navigation rules and tonnage regulation of Panama Canal.
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河的航行和吨位规定。

sentences.english: Even hilly countries can be canalized.
sentences.chinese: 即使在多山的地区也可以开凿运河。

sentences.english: On one side of the canal is historical relics, another side modern arts, both of which bring Otaru two different feelings.
sentences.chinese: 运河一面古迹，一面时尚，牵动着小樽的两种情绪。

sentences.english: The town featured a rich history, and was well-known for its culture and traditions along its canals.
sentences.chinese: 青浦历史悠久，以运河文化和传统闻名。

sentences.english: This is the earliest section of the Beijing-Hangzhou Canal.
sentences.chinese: 这是京杭运河最早建成的一段。

sentences.english: The peloton passes a canal in Nemours during the fifth stage July 8.
sentences.chinese: 该珀洛东证在第五个阶段，7月8日在内穆尔运河。

sentences.english: This project is at the southern end of Gongchen Bridge in north Gongshu, which is the south terminal of Jing-Hang Canal.
sentences.chinese: 该项目位于拱墅区北部拱宸桥南，是京杭运河的南端。

sentences.english: So the canal joined the Great Lakes with the Atlantic Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 所以，伊利运河就把五大湖与大西洋连接起来了。

sentences.english: The city is criss-crossed with canals.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市里运河纵横交错。

sentences.english: Liu's monologue was a refreshing moment of authenticity here in Wuzhen, an ancient town known for its charming canals and traditional architecture.
sentences.chinese: 乌镇是一个古镇，以其迷人的运河和传统建筑而闻名。

sentences.english: He crossed a lake in a canoe first then took a ship to sail on the canal.
sentences.chinese: 他先乘独木舟渡过一个湖泊然后乘船在运河上航行。

sentences.english: Horses used to tow barges along the canal.
sentences.chinese: 过去马常常沿运河拖船。

sentences.english: He rowed up the canal looking for a place to dock the boat.
sentences.chinese: 他在运河里划船，寻找一个码头泊船。

sentences.english: The canal melts and everything rouses up from sleeping.
The Panama Canal opened almost one hundred years ago.
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河开通于近100年前。

definition: the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
(old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax
Huai River, main river of east China, between the Yellow River 黃河|黄河[Huang2 He2] and the Changjiang 長江|长江[Chang2 Jiang1]
